dublin_core.dcvalue: Health enabling technologies and ambient assisted living are important fields in biomedical informatics In this context a huge variety of analysis methods are applied Neither is a suitable structuring of these methods available nor is an aid known for selecting appropriate methods for a given set of data specifying a context and a problem The goal of the present paper is to present a prototype of a semantic collaboration tool which is based on the Systematic Nomenclature for Contexts Analysis Methods and Problems in Health Enabling Technologies SNOCAP HET This tool can be seen as a first step towards an assistance system for decision support within SNOCAP HET We present aspects of the selection and modeling process of our tool and discuss its benefits and appealing tasks for further research Moreover we present a number of already planned and some unspecified upcoming steps which should optimize SNOCAP HET in the future
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:50:17Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2013-12-18
A collaboration tool based on SNOCAP-HET.
